title: Fryderyk Chopin
subtitle: A Romantic Revolution and an Endless Legacy
description:
Welcome to a fascinating exploration of Frédéric Chopin's musical history. From his early compositions in Poland to becoming the undisputed icon of Romanticism in Paris, this extraordinary composer redefined the language of the piano. He created a unique sound that merged classical elegance with deep emotional expression and veiled patriotism.

Join us as we trace his evolution and explore his most revolutionary works, such as the Nocturnes, Waltzes, and Études. Prepare to immerse yourself in the lyrical and vibrant world of Frédéric Chopin and discover the magic behind his immortal music.

dynamic_elements.count_query:
PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>
PREFIX dbo: <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/>
PREFIX dbp: <http://dbpedia.org/property/>

SELECT (COUNT(DISTINCT ?titles) AS ?count)
WHERE {
  
  # 1. Trova l'entità MusicBo e il suo nome
  ?musician amr:name ?musicianLabel .
  FILTER contains(LCASE(str(?musicianLabel)), "chopin").
  
  # 2. Ottieni l'URI di DBpedia (che è l'URI di REDIRECT)
  ?musician owl:sameAs ?dbpediaRedirect . # Esempio: http://dbpedia.org/resource/Frederic_Chopin
  
  # 3. SERVICE: Richiesta federata a DBpedia
  SERVICE <https://dbpedia.org/sparql> {
    
    # 4. IL SALTO (IL TRUCCO): Seguiamo il redirect per trovare l'URI canonico
    # Usiamo l'URI di redirect per trovare l'URI che contiene i dati.
    ?dbpediaRedirect dbo:wikiPageRedirects ?canonicalDBPediaURI . # Ora ?canonicalDBPediaURI è http://dbpedia.org/resource/Frédéric_Chopin
    
    # 5. Estraiamo i dati dall'URI canonico
    ?canonicalDBPediaURI dbp:works ?linkedPage .
    
    ?linkedPage dbo:wikiPageWikiLink ?titles.
    
    ?titles rdfs:label ?titlesLabel .
    ?titles dbo:description ?titlesDescription .
    FILTER (lang(?titlesLabel) = "en").
    FILTER (
        CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?titlesLabel)), "chopin") || 
        CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?titlesDescription)), "chopin")
    )
    
  }
}

dynamic_elements.text:
In addition to his prolific output as a composer, Frédéric Chopin held influential roles that shaped his life and musical legacy. Although he is celebrated worldwide as one of the greatest composers in history, his career was also defined by a variety of professional activities that were essential for both his livelihood and his growing influence in Parisian cultural circles.

 The doughnutchart below shows all of his professional activities.

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>
PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>

SELECT DISTINCT (?occupationLabel as ?label)
WHERE {

  # 1. Trova l'entità MusicBo
  ?musician amr:name ?musicianLabel .
  FILTER CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?musicianLabel)), "chopin") .
  ?musician owl:sameAs ?wikiPerson .

  # 2. Richiesta federata a Wikidata
  SERVICE <https://query.wikidata.org/sparql> {
    ?wikiPerson wdt:P106 ?occupation .
    ?occupation rdfs:label ?occupationLabel .
    FILTER (lang(?occupationLabel) = "en")
  }
}

dynamic_elements.text: Observing the bar chart below allows us to clearly and immediately see how many pieces were composed for each of the main typological groups, such as waltzes, nocturnes and mazurkas. This graphic representation highlights the genres to which he devoted most of his attention and emphasises his preference for short forms and his commitment to consolidating the canon of Romantic piano music.

dynamic_elements.chart_query:
PREFIX dbo: <http://dbpedia.org/ontology/>
PREFIX dbr: <http://dbpedia.org/resource/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX dct: <http://purl.org/dc/terms/>

SELECT (?tipoPulito AS ?label) (COUNT(DISTINCT ?list) as ?count)
WHERE {
  
  # 1. Partiamo dalla lista (Hub)
  BIND(dbr:List_of_compositions_by_Frédéric_Chopin AS ?listaOpere)

  SERVICE <https://dbpedia.org/sparql> {
    
    # 2. Seguiamo i link alle opere
    ?listaOpere dbo:wikiPageWikiLink ?opera .
    ?opera dbo:wikiPageWikiLink ?list .
    
    ?list dct:subject ?categoria .
    ?categoria rdfs:label ?catLabel .
    
    FILTER(langMatches(lang(?catLabel), "en"))
    FILTER(CONTAINS(?catLabel, "Chopin"))
    FILTER(CONTAINS(?catLabel, "by"))
    
   
    
   
  }
  BIND(STRBEFORE(STR(?catLabel), " by") AS ?tipoPulito)
}
GROUP BY ?tipoPulito

dynamic_elements.text:
Frédéric Chopin's life was shaped by both his compositions and the places that welcomed him along the way. From his native Poland to his self-imposed exile in France, his life was a journey filled with musical triumphs and personal struggles.

Throughout his life, Chopin lived, studied and worked in various European cities and regions, each of which influenced his music and artistic development.

Explore this itinerant dimension by consulting the map below, which traces the main stages of his journey, from his youth in Warsaw, to his time in Vienna and Paris, and his travels.

dynamic_elements.map_points_query:
PREFIX wdt: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/direct/>
PREFIX rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#>
PREFIX owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#>
PREFIX amr: <http://www.ontologydesignpatterns.org/ont/amr/>
PREFIX wikibase: <http://wikiba.se/ontology#>
PREFIX p: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/>
PREFIX psv: <http://www.wikidata.org/prop/statement/value/>

SELECT DISTINCT (?residence AS ?point) ?residenceLabel ?lat ?long
WHERE {
  ?musician amr:name ?musicianLabel .
  FILTER CONTAINS(LCASE(STR(?musicianLabel)), "chopin") .
  ?musician owl:sameAs ?wikiPerson . 

  SERVICE <https://query.wikidata.org/sparql> {
    
    ?wikiPerson wdt:P551 ?residence . 
    ?residence rdfs:label ?residenceLabel .
    FILTER (lang(?residenceLabel) = "en") .
    
    OPTIONAL {
      ?residence p:P625 ?coords_stmt . 
      ?coords_stmt psv:P625 [ wikibase:geoLatitude ?lat; wikibase:geoLongitude ?long ] .
    }
  }
}
ORDER BY ?residenceLabel
